FuncDef:
The scp server enable command enables the SCP service on the SSH server.
The undo scp server enable command disables the SCP service on the SSH server. The scp server enable command enables the SCP service on the SSH server. The undo scp server enable command disables the SCP service on the SSH server. By default, the SCP service is disabled on the SSH server.
ExtraInfo:
To use SCP for file transfer, you must enable the SCP service on the SSH server. A client can connect to a remote SSH server by SCP only after the SCP service is enabled on the SSH server.
The scp server enable command enables both IPv4 and IPv6 SCP services on the SSH server.
